result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony R Robinson in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Anthony R Robinson.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel has a scheduling conflict on 10-28-2022. Court rescheduled hearing.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony R Robinson in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Anthony R Robinson.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony R Robinson in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Anthony R Robinson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
